channel.title: How do i add shops.?
channel.description: I need a complete guide to adding shops. My server base came without shops and ive edited like crazy and do not want to restart >:O Please Help!![br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 07, 2008, 08:43:25 PM[/size][hr]omg so many people read and no one helps at all.

item.title: How do i add shops.?
item.dc:creator: @lolvengeance lolvengeance
item.description:
@lolvengeance wrote:

spawn an npc for your shop keeper in your autospawn then save.
go into shops.cfg, copy a shop and paste it to the bottom of your list, change the shop id (shop = #), the name and the items.
go into client.java and search
‘wanneshop = 2’
copy that little shop code and paste another just under it.
change the npcid to the npc’s id that you just made in autospawn, and change the shop id to the id of your shop you just made in shops.cfg

Read full topic

item.title: How do i add shops.?
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

Add an npc to your autospawn.cfg, choose it’s X and Y coords, Save, close autospawn.cfg, now, go into client.java, and find another shop under first click npc’s, paste it, change the name of it to the name of your new shop, then change the npc id to your new shop’s npc id, save, close client.java, go into shops.cfg, and copy a line, paste it at the very end, and make sure the shop id is the continuation of the one before it, so if the one before it was 89, the new shop your trying to add, it’s shop id would be 90, and, change all the item id’s to the things you want, here is kind of what it should look like

shop = 70	Skillcape Shop				2	2	14074	200	14075	200	14077	200	14078	200	14080	200	14081	200	14083	200	14084	200	14086	200	14087	200	14089	200	14090	200	14092	200	14093	200	14095	200	14096	200	14098	200	14099	200	14101	200	14087	200	14104	200	14105	200	14106	200	14108	200	14110	200	14111	200	14113	200	14114	200	14116	200	14117	200	14119	200	14120	200	14125	200	14126	200	14128	200	14129	200	14131	200	14132	200

All those 200’s are the item amounts, the other numbers such as 14129, are the item id’s, Hope this helped

Read full topic
